channel.title: Homes on Alex Ledger
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Alex Ledger

item.description: Email: a.led1027 <at> gmail <dot> com Github: github.com/aled1027 I am a software engineer focused on building tools and applications that enhance privacy and security. I have experience writing secure, cryptography code and building privacy-enhancing technologies. I currently work in the Secure Resilient Systems and Technology Group at MIT Lincoln Lab, where my team is building a programming framework for secure multi-party computation (MPC) protocols. Before joining MIT Lincoln Lab, I studied Mathematics and Computer Science at Reed College.

item.title: Interests and Technologies
item.description: Interests Cryptography, Computer Security, Privacy, Anonymity Machine Learning, Data Analysis and Visualization Technologies C, C++, Python, Java, Rust, Haskell, Clojure, R, Matlab, Octave, Mathematica, Coq AWS, Linux, Bash, Git, Latex, SQL, MongoDB, NoSQL

item.title: Work and Projects
item.description: Framework for Efficient Development of Secure Multi-party Computation At MIT Lincoln Lab, I work on a team designing and developing a framework for secure multi-party computation (MPC) protocols. MPC is a privacy-enhancing, cryptographic technique for securely computing functions on private data - that is, the inputs and all intermediate values are never revealed to anyone. Our framework is focused on improving the speed at which developers can implement MPC protocols and applications.
